brief_description: Establish whether MAIT cells participate in pathophysiology of UC
description: Establish whether MAIT cells participate in pathophysiology of UC
hypothesis: MAIT cell frequency and gene expression differ according to presence or absence of UC-associated inflammation.
objectives: 1. Determine MAIT frequency in peripheral blood, normal and inflamed colonic mucosa in patients with UC. 2. Profile MAIT cells from patients with UC using single cell analysis
official_title: Characterizing the Activation of Mucosal-Associated Invariant T (MAIT) Cells in Ulcerative Colitis (UC)
sponsoring_organization: Scripps Clinic Medical Group Research and Education Award 2016 (awarded to G. Konijeti)

arm.description: Patients with UC, not on immunosuppression or systemic steroids
arm.name: Patients with UC
